channel.title: Fishing
channel.description: Alot of people think its boring. I like it . Do you? Why or why not.

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

My friend foul hooked a small carp Friday. We didn’t have a knife so we took a pair of pliers and squeezed him in half. I then proceeded to cast out the tail end and I reeled in a 20 pound turtle we nicknamed “Gramps”.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

We don’t have very large bass up here. Largest bass I’ve ever seen is about one pound, although I know people who have caught up to 3 pounds.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

The Wanderer:

We just use minnows for bait when we are fishing for crappie. Where do you hook the bluegill when you use it for bait? I usually hook the minnow in the meaty part of the tail.

Through the eye cus its the fish alive and the skull keeps the hook on there. If the blue gill is too big the fish just wont eat it so for the 5 inchers i usually cut em in half. (Was messing around when I caught the 22in.)

If you can get your hands on some night crawlers they also work. Get a small - medium sized hook, put the hook through the head and drag it through the body. Cast out and reel in slow. Bass love it.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Dunder Mifflin, post:21, topic:440848”][quote author=The Wanderer link=topic=543523.msg3984088#msg3984088 date=1335657721]
I love fishing. We go fishing to flay the fish and eat. Absolutely love bluegills. Largest redear I ever caught was about a pound and a half. Not the largest, by far, but the largest I have ever seen around here. Caught 4 one pound crappies the other weekend. Largest crappie I’ve ever seen was an 18 inch crappie my dad caught when I was tiny. Was massive.
[/quote]

Sounds fun. I like to catch small little 3-5 inchers to warm up and I throw em in a bucket. Rehook em and use the fuckers as bait. Catch the big suckers like that[/quote]

This.

Hooked up a small shiner and cast it out. About 5 minutes later I hooked a 15 inch Crappie. i was so stoked. Didn’t eat it, I kissed it and sent it packing.

I used a small 5 inch blue gill and cast it out in a lake near my house. Hooked a 22 inch bass and sent in a citation. I got a reward, was stoked. I’ll post a picture of it.

I live by the ocean so in the summer I can go flounder fishing off the shore. In the winter I go for Striper; it’s like reeling in a bull dog.

tl;dr : I love fishing.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:25, topic:440848”][quote author=frozon566 link=topic=543523.msg3984252#msg3984252 date=1335678693]
Also, little note, never bring your ladies on a fishing trip, you’ll regret it.
[/quote]Only people who live in the city o.o? Most of the ladies where I live fish better then most of the guys. But then again most of them also hunt better then the guys too.[/quote]
I’m not saying women can’t fish, but i’m certainly not saying there adroitness has ever been percieved by me.

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:24, topic:440848”][quote author=frozon566 link=topic=543523.msg3984252#msg3984252 date=1335678693]
Also, little note, never bring your ladies on a fishing trip, you’ll regret it.
[/quote]
lol why?[/quote]

Back about a year ago I thought it would be “fun” to bring this girl Terra i was seeing since none of my guy friends could come, long story short, if your in the middle of a lake on a boat with a woman and you get into an argument, not only are you going to lose the argument, its going to take you 20 minutes before you can get back on land so you two can storm off.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

Fishing is one of my favorite activities, I’m afraid of fishing in oceans or if the lakes are too big,

but its definitely a lot more enjoyable if you bring some friends with you to chat up.

Also, little note, never bring your ladies on a fishing trip, you’ll regret it.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Never had luck doing that. We don’t have any real predatory fish around here. Largest would be a largemouth bass or a channel cat. Although in the ohio river there are some really large gar. Never caught one myself, although I have seen some swim by in our creek (connected to the ohio). Never had luck catching a channel cat on a fish head or anything. Usually use chicken liver.

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @Dunder_Mifflin1 Dunder Mifflin
item.description:
@Dunder_Mifflin1 wrote:

The Wanderer:

I love fishing. We go fishing to flay the fish and eat. Absolutely love bluegills. Largest redear I ever caught was about a pound and a half. Not the largest, by far, but the largest I have ever seen around here. Caught 4 one pound crappies the other weekend. Largest crappie I’ve ever seen was an 18 inch crappie my dad caught when I was tiny. Was massive.

Sounds fun. I like to catch small little 3-5 inchers to warm up and I throw em in a bucket. Rehook em and use the fuckers as bait. Catch the big suckers like that

Read full topic

item.title: Fishing
item.dc:creator: @Dremorain Dremorain
item.description:
@Dremorain wrote:

i only go fishing in RL with my family, it’s more of a bonding thing than anything i actually want to do.
i like it in RS, though. it’s so simple and easy, it’s something i can do and be sociable in my clan or focus on whatever i’m doing outside of RS. like homework or something.

Read full topic
